intro: Sarcolobus lifuensis, commonly known as the Lifuensis sarcobolus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
